attributes.action: re-consider the role of the honours system within the nation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The British Honours System used to be a fine establishment, that bestowed the greatest honour to those who sacrificed much to improve the lives of others. In service to the country. It is currently horrific to see that those who are now honoured already receive grand awards, in the form of obsurd pay packets, fame and fortune, and from benefitting from those who spend much time doing the work. Furthermore there are Royal Chivalric Orders such as the Order of St John who are not even allowed to use their honours as a prefix (e.g. Knights Grand Cross), even though these are only achieved through true acts of goodness for the society. I understand that Honours are appointed by HM on the advice of yourselves. However it should not be used to increase fame and economic profit, but to HONOUR and encourage greater community participation and cohesion.
